google_play_reviews.replyContent:
You can continue using v1 if that suits your needs better.
https://github.com/trynoice/android-app/releases/tag/1.3.3

google_play_reviews.content: Apparently the developers of this app decided to take an anti-consumer stance. They don't want to provide sounds with the APK, because it would increase the size - they prefer to make it unusable offline and potentially incurre additional data charges. They are switching to a subscription service - paywalling new features. In the process of updating they also removed Chromecast support. Noice may one day become a decent cross-platform web-service, but as an open-souce app - it's dead.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Facing a few setbacks in readding the Chromecast support. It will remain free. While offline playback is a paid feature, the app also caches sounds without it to reduce data usage. v2 content is both longer and of high quality. It was impossible with v1. You can continue using v1.
https://github.com/trynoice/android-app/releases/tag/1.3.3

google_play_reviews.content: Edited from 5 to 1 new update is horrible. Now you have to be online to access the sounds and they don't play constantly. Random sounds shutting off while playing, presets not working. I liked that this was a simple open source app you're trying to turn it into a big creepy app that needs constant internet connectivity just like everything else these days.

Used to be amazing. Absolutely ruined after update. Literally unusable. Thanks alot now I can't sleep until I find a new app THE NIGHT BEFORE A HUGE EVENT I MUST GET UP EXTRA EARLY FOR!!! Been using this app for years. All my presets are ruined. All my work gone. Most of the sounds are suddenly removed. Went from 3 types of rain to 1. Went from 3 types of thunder with adjustable timing to 1 with no timing adjustment. Good work you fools now your app is terrible and uninstalled

After I first installed it a few months ago, I found many of the noises lifelike, charming, and relaxing. I especially loved the "Purring Cat" which I found the most calming. As of August 18/22 I noticed the sound quality of ALL the sounds are discordant which is disappointing and no longer nice to listen to (BTW it is NOT my speakers!). The developer responded that it was being worked on, but after more updates, as of September 15/22 no changes have been made. Sad. Will uninstall.
google_play_reviews.replyContent:
Already on it! Please give it a couple of days and it should be resolved.

Edit 16/10/22: I have made the changes. I apologise that it took unexpectedly long to resolve this issue.

google_play_reviews.content: I used to use this app before the premium plans started. It was a pretty good app and served its purpose well. But now it seems like the developers got greedy. Subscription model for premium sounds? You guys hardly provide 20 sounds and you have a subscription model. Just seems unfair and greedy to be honest. Edit: What a response from the developer! How about you get a job and stop begging for money by distributing free stuff if you are that concerned about paying your bills?
google_play_reviews.replyContent:

google_play_reviews.replyContent: The seamless issue is related to how an upstream dependency handles device media codecs and it should work fine on most of the devices. On some devices, it won't work and there's nothing I can no. And it doesn't cost money for Noice to be a simple app that makes noise; it costs money for a few additional features that are optional.

google_play_reviews.replyContent: I don't mean to disappoint, but the pay-wall is coming in the next version. Although, the free content will change, I am aiming that these changes should be further improvements instead of limitations. The paid content will include longer sounds, and future feature implementations will also have premium components.

I really love the premise of the app, but I ran into a serious issue with it: I'm having a hard time sleeping because of a low frequency hum in my home, so I figured this app could mask out the sound and help me sleep. It succeeded at masking the hum, but after a while I started noticing the looping nature of some of the sounds, which then kept me awake. Also one of the rain sounds has a short high pitched tone every 7 or 8 seconds. Once noticed, it becomes really hard not to hear it.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the report. I've found the issues, will fix them in the next release. It should be available in a couple of weeks.

google_play_reviews.content: Great little app, just what I needed. I love mixing sounds and it's easy to use. I like the different themes and think the sleep timer is a nice touch. The recorded sounds are all great quality and loop very smoothly and I love that you can change their frequency and volume individually. No more using YouTube white noise videos for me! One thing I would like would be the option to record or add your own sounds.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your support! Custom sounds had been discussed earlier. I had other concerns but as of now, Chromecast doesn't have a means to play custom sounds. Earlier discussion: https://github.com/ashutoshgngwr/noice/issues/142

google_play_reviews.content: Fantastic app. The sounds are incredibly soothing and while the library isn't huge, it's plenty to make a nice soundscape. Instantly one of my favorite apps.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the review. Feel free to suggest any sounds you had on your mind.

google_play_reviews.content: Very good app! Adding to the suggestions from others: maybe make the ambience list a bit more visual, e.g. with royalty free stock pictures for the list items' background? It would make it quicker to find a sound without having to read the label. Similarly, saved presets could be color-coded? Thanks!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for the feedback. Visuals can be done but it's technically really hard to maintain. Finding good graphics for each sound and then having to update them as library changes. I had this in Chromecast receiver app but had to remove it for the same reason. Consumed too much development time and created very little value.

google_play_reviews.content: Thank you so much for fixing the end of loop issue! Perfect! Absolutely brilliant, and ad free which makes it perfect. Found this on f droid. Thank you for making such a fantastic and ad-free noise app. Would absolutely recommend everyone try this app.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your support! :) Edit 28 Sept: Hey Elizabeth, The update with the fix is now available to download. Thanks for reporting the issue! Sorry for the inconvenience caused.

google_play_reviews.content: Nice app. Like a lot of other reviewers, I found this on F-Droid. Works perfectly, and is open source! There is a background noise web app that provides this functionality (not sure where they source their sounds from). This is already a 5 star app. With the addition above, would be a 6 star app!
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your support! I'll try to find the requested samples. No promises!

google_play_reviews.content: Also available on F-Droid.
google_play_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your support. The Play Store version supports Chromecast for both audio and TV devices (using non-free GMS APIs). Besides that, its pretty much identical to the F-Droid version.
